Operation 'getListingViolationsSummary' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity on what is returned (violation counts summary), doesn't explain the response structure (ComplianceSummary with violationSummaries), and doesn't clearly indicate this is seller-specific data. Added summary and improved description to clarify the aggregated nature of results, the filtering capability, multi-marketplace scope, and sandbox limitations for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
This call returns listing violation counts for a seller. A user can pass in one or more compliance types through the compliance_type query parameter. See ComplianceTypeEnum for more information on the supported listing compliance types. Listing violations are returned for multiple marketplaces if the seller sells on multiple eBay marketplaces.

Note: Only a canned response, with counts for all listing compliance types, is returned in the Sandbox environment. Due to this limitation, the compliance_type query parameter (if used) will not have an effect on the response.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve listing violation counts by compliance type
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a summary of listing violation counts for the authenticated seller, aggregated by compliance type and marketplace. Accepts optional compliance_type query parameter to filter results to specific compliance types (see ComplianceTypeEnum for supported types). Returns violation counts across all eBay marketplaces where the seller operates. Note: Sandbox environment returns canned data for all compliance types regardless of filters.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description lacks clarity on what is returned (violation counts summary), doesn't explain the response structure (ComplianceSummary with violationSummaries), and doesn't clearly indicate this is seller-specific data. Added summary and improved description to clarify the aggregated nature of results, the filtering capability, multi-marketplace scope, and sandbox limitations for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'getListingViolations' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and scattered across multiple notes, making it difficult for AI agents to understand the core operation, required parameters, response structure, and practical constraints. Reorganized to clarify: single compliance type requirement, pagination support, response type (PagedComplianceViolationCollection), the 2000-violation limit and its implications, and sandbox behavior. This improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
This call returns specific listing violations for the supported listing compliance types. Only one compliance type can be passed in per call, and the response will include all the listing violations for this compliance type, and listing violations are grouped together by eBay listing ID. See ComplianceTypeEnum for more information on the supported listing compliance types. This method also has pagination control.

Note: A maximum of 2000 listing violations will be returned in a result set. If the seller has more than 2000 listing violations, some/all of those listing violations must be corrected before additional listing violations will be retrieved. The user should pay attention to the total value in the response. If this value is '2000', it is possible that the seller has more than 2000 listing violations, but this field maxes out at 2000.
Note: In a future release of this API, the seller will be able to pass in a specific eBay listing ID as a query parameter to see if this specific listing has any violations.
Note: Only mocked non-compliant listing data will be returned for this call in the Sandbox environment, and not specific to the seller. However, the user can still use this mock data to experiment with the compliance type filters and pagination control.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve detailed listing violations by compliance type
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed listing violations for the authenticated seller filtered by a single compliance type. Results are grouped by eBay listing ID and support pagination. Accepts compliance_type parameter (required, see ComplianceTypeEnum) and pagination parameters (limit, offset). Returns PagedComplianceViolationCollection containing violation details, corrective recommendations, and product suggestions. Maximum 2000 violations returned per request; if total equals 2000, additional violations may exist and must be addressed before retrieval. Sandbox returns mocked non-compliant data for testing compliance filters and pagination.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is verbose and scattered across multiple notes, making it difficult for AI agents to understand the core operation, required parameters, response structure, and practical constraints. Reorganized to clarify: single compliance type requirement, pagination support, response type (PagedComplianceViolationCollection), the 2000-violation limit and its implications, and sandbox behavior. This improves AI agent interpretability for determining when and how to use this operation.
